doc:doc.doc:para: The Call object is used to initiate, accept, release, and otherwise deal with voice calls. It also allows you to send DTMF tones.

doc:doc.doc:description: Sent whenever there is any status or property change on a call in the system, no matter whether this is an incoming, active, held, or released call.
doc:doc.doc:inote: This signal is emitted once for every 'RING' from the modem.

doc:doc.doc:summary: The index of the call that changed its status or properties.

The new status of the call. Expected values are: "incoming" = The call is incoming (but not yet accepted), "outgoing" = The call is outgoing (but not yet established), "active" = The call is the active call (you can talk), "held" = The call is being held, "released" = The call is being released. Further information can be part of the properties.

An array of changed property values. To get the full status for a call, you need to issue the GetCallStatus() method. Note that the properties are optional. Expected tuples are: ( "reason", string ) = The reason for the status change (on outgoing calls e.g. 'BUSY' or 'NO CARRIER') ( "number", string ) = The number of the peer (on incoming calls only if we received a CLIP) ... [ add more here ] ( "auxstatus", string ) = An auxillary connection status (if your modem supports that), ...

doc:doc.doc:description: Activate a call as single active call. All previously active calls are put on hold. No difference is made whether this is an incoming call or a call that has been put on hold.
Activate a call in addition to all previously active calls. No difference is made whether this is an incoming call or a call that has been put on hold.
Join all active and held calls and release them.
Transfer an incoming or active call to another number.

doc:doc.doc:summary: The number to transfer the call to.

doc:doc.doc:description: Release all calls, no matter whether active or put on hold.

doc:doc.doc:inote: This is implemented using the atd command.

doc:doc.doc:description: Retrieve the status for all calls in the system.

doc:doc.doc:summary: The call status. This is an array containing a call status record for every single call. For the format description, please see the CallStatus signal.

doc:doc.doc:description: Send one or more Dual Tone Multiple Frequency (DTMF) signals during an active call.
doc:doc.doc:inote: This maps to the TIA IS 101 command +VTS=(value), see 3GPP TS 07.07 Chapter C.2.11.

doc:doc.doc:summary: The tones to send. Allowed values are: (0-9,#,*,A-D)
